title: Trump is weighing an executive action to cap credit card interest rates at 10%
body: President Donald Trump is weighing an executive action to cap credit card interest rates as Congress remains stuck. The 10% credit card plan sits inside a broader affordability agenda. That agenda includes blocking institutional investors from buying single‑family homes and allowing savers to tap 401(k) plans for home down payments. Timing remains uncertain, but Trump said more details will come when he speaks at the World Economic Forum in Davos next week. National Economic Council Director Kevin Hassett said on Fox Business that talks with major banks are active. “They think that the president’s on to something,” Kevin said during the interview. At the same time, housing policy is also under review. Officials are discussing whether to block stock buybacks by publicly traded homebuilders. Bill Pulte, head of the Federal Housing Finance Agency, raised the idea earlier this week in an interview with the Wall Street Journal. No decisions have been finalized. White House officials say discussions are still moving. The administration did not respond to requests for comment as talks continued behind closed doors. Late last week, Trump called for a one‑year 10% cap on credit card rates and set January 20 as the deadline. His team has also met with homebuilders to discuss affordability. Financial firms spent days trying to figure out how the order would work. Industry trade groups began planning responses and warned the cap could hit lower‑income borrowers and disrupt lending. Pressure increased when Press Secretary Karoline Leavitt spoke on Thursday. She said companies are expected to lower rates by the deadline. She called it a “demand” from Trump. Banks push back as consumers and lobbyists weigh outcomes The issue dominated earnings calls at major banks this week. JPMorgan Chase, Citigroup, and Bank of America all raised concerns. Executives said they lack enough detail to measure the impact on their businesses. Citigroup Chief Financial Officer Mark Mason said a government‑mandated cap could slow economic activity. Bank of America Chief Executive Officer Brian Moynihan said it could limit access to credit if banks pull back. Bank trade groups also pushed back. “We’re talking about unsecured lending, so it’s not like an auto loan or a mortgage loan where there’s something you can take back,” said Rob Nichols, head of the American Bankers Association. Lobbyists spent the week trying to understand how Trump might implement the order. One option under discussion is using the interstate commerce clause to override state usury limits, according to a lobbyist involved in the talks. Some consumer advocates warned that a 10% cap could be too low and lead banks to cut lending. Others pointed to federal credit unions, which already operate under rate caps. “It’s about finding a reasonable rate that doesn’t undermine the ability of consumers who are struggling to get by,” said Adam Rust of the Consumer Federation of America. Kevin also floated the idea that banks could voluntarily launch new Trump cards. Bilt rolled out three cards earlier this week with rates capped at 10%, though the limit lasts one year and applies only to new purchases. Don’t just read crypto news. Understand it. Subscribe to our newsletter. It's free .

title: White House Crypto Bill Support Hangs in Balance as Coinbase Dispute Escalates Dramatically
body: BitcoinWorld White House Crypto Bill Support Hangs in Balance as Coinbase Dispute Escalates Dramatically WASHINGTON, D.C. — March 2025 — The Biden administration now faces a critical decision point regarding landmark cryptocurrency legislation, as sources reveal the White House may withdraw support for the CLARITY Act following Coinbase’s unexpected departure from negotiations. This development marks a significant escalation in the ongoing debate about how to regulate digital assets in the United States, potentially derailing years of legislative progress. White House Crypto Bill Faces Unprecedented Challenge The Crypto-Asset Reporting, Liquidity, and Institutional Transparency (CLARITY) Act represents the most comprehensive cryptocurrency market structure legislation proposed in Congress. Lawmakers designed the bill to establish clear regulatory frameworks for digital assets, stablecoins, and decentralized finance platforms. However, recent developments threaten to undermine this legislative effort completely. According to multiple sources familiar with the negotiations, the White House expressed serious concerns about Coinbase’s withdrawal from discussions. Eleanor Terrett, host of Crypto in America, first reported this development. Administration officials characterized Coinbase’s move as unexpected and potentially damaging to both regulatory progress and industry stability. The legislation’s future now depends heavily on whether Coinbase returns to negotiations with acceptable terms regarding stablecoin yields for traditional banking institutions. This specific issue has emerged as the primary sticking point in recent weeks. Coinbase’s Concerns About the CLARITY Act Coinbase officially rescinded its support for the legislation last week, citing several substantive concerns about the bill’s current language. The company identified four primary issues that prompted their withdrawal from negotiations: Tokenized Stock Restrictions: Provisions that could effectively ban tokenized traditional securities DeFi Limitations: Language that might block decentralized finance platforms from operating legally Financial Surveillance: Sections permitting unlimited access to user financial information Regulatory Authority Shifts: Provisions weakening CFTC authority while strengthening SEC oversight Coinbase representatives particularly emphasized concerns about stablecoin reward functions. They argued that certain provisions could prevent stablecoin issuers from offering yield-generating products. This limitation would significantly impact the economic viability of many stablecoin models currently operating in the market. Regulatory Jurisdiction Battle Intensifies The legislation’s treatment of regulatory authority has sparked considerable debate among industry observers. Currently, the Commodity Futures Trading Commission (CFTC) oversees cryptocurrency derivatives and certain spot markets. Meanwhile, the Securities and Exchange Commission (SEC) maintains jurisdiction over securities offerings and exchanges. The CLARITY Act proposes shifting more authority to the SEC, a move that concerns many cryptocurrency advocates. They argue that the SEC’s traditional securities framework doesn’t adequately address the unique characteristics of digital assets. This regulatory tension represents a fundamental challenge for cryptocurrency legislation in the United States. Key Regulatory Differences Between CFTC and SEC Approaches Aspect CFTC Approach SEC Approach Primary Framework Commodities Regulation Securities Regulation Registration Requirements Generally Lighter Extensive and Complex r> Disclosure Standards Market Transparency Focus Investor Protection Focus Innovation Philosophy More Accommodating More Restrictive Stablecoin Yield Negotiations Reach Impasse The most immediate conflict centers on stablecoin yield provisions for traditional banks. Banking institutions seek regulatory clarity about how they can offer yield-generating stablecoin products. Meanwhile, cryptocurrency companies worry about unfair competitive advantages for traditional financial institutions. Stablecoins represent digital assets pegged to stable reserves like the U.S. dollar. These cryptocurrencies have grown tremendously in recent years, with total market capitalization exceeding $150 billion. The yield debate specifically concerns how these assets generate returns for holders through various mechanisms. Traditional banks argue they need clear regulatory pathways to compete with cryptocurrency-native companies. Conversely, cryptocurrency firms express concerns about regulatory capture. They fear established financial institutions might use regulation to disadvantage innovative competitors. Historical Context of Cryptocurrency Legislation This legislative effort follows years of regulatory uncertainty in the cryptocurrency space. Congress first began serious discussions about comprehensive digital asset legislation in 2022. Multiple bills have since been introduced, but none have reached the president’s desk for signature. The CLARITY Act emerged from bipartisan negotiations in 2024. Lawmakers from both parties worked with industry stakeholders to craft balanced legislation. Their goal was to provide regulatory clarity while fostering innovation in the rapidly evolving digital asset ecosystem. Previous legislative attempts faced similar challenges regarding regulatory jurisdiction and stablecoin treatment. However, the current dispute represents the most significant threat to legislative progress in recent memory. Industry observers note that without Coinbase’s support, the legislation faces substantial obstacles in Congress. Potential Impacts on Cryptocurrency Markets The uncertainty surrounding this legislation could have immediate effects on cryptocurrency markets. Regulatory clarity represents a crucial factor for institutional investment in digital assets. Many traditional financial institutions have delayed significant cryptocurrency investments pending legislative outcomes. Market analysts identify several potential consequences if the legislation stalls: Continued Regulatory Uncertainty: Extended period without clear rules for market participants Reduced Institutional Participation: Traditional financial firms may remain cautious Innovation Migration: Cryptocurrency companies might relocate to more favorable jurisdictions Market Volatility: Increased price fluctuations due to regulatory uncertainty International competition represents another significant consideration. Other jurisdictions, including the European Union and United Kingdom, have advanced their own cryptocurrency regulatory frameworks. The United States risks falling behind in the global competition for digital asset innovation if legislation continues to stall. Broader Implications for Financial Innovation This dispute extends beyond immediate regulatory concerns to fundamental questions about financial innovation. The cryptocurrency industry represents one of the most significant technological disruptions in finance since the internet. How regulators approach this innovation will shape financial markets for decades. Traditional financial institutions increasingly recognize the transformative potential of blockchain technology. Many major banks now explore various blockchain applications. However, regulatory uncertainty creates significant barriers to meaningful adoption and integration. The current impasse highlights the tension between innovation and regulation that characterizes technological disruption. Finding the appropriate balance remains challenging for policymakers worldwide. The United States’ approach will likely influence regulatory developments in other major economies. Conclusion The White House’s potential withdrawal of support for the crypto bill represents a critical juncture for cryptocurrency regulation in the United States. The dispute between the administration and Coinbase over stablecoin yields and market structure provisions threatens to derail years of legislative progress. As negotiations reach this impasse, the future of comprehensive cryptocurrency legislation remains uncertain. Market participants, regulators, and policymakers now await Coinbase’s next move and the administration’s final decision regarding the White House crypto bill. FAQs Q1: What is the CLARITY Act? The Crypto-Asset Reporting, Liquidity, and Institutional Transparency (CLARITY) Act represents comprehensive legislation designed to establish clear regulatory frameworks for digital assets, stablecoins, and decentralized finance platforms in the United States. Q2: Why did Coinbase withdraw support for the legislation? Coinbase cited concerns about tokenized stock restrictions, DeFi limitations, financial surveillance provisions, regulatory authority shifts, and stablecoin reward function limitations as reasons for withdrawing support. Q3: What are stablecoin yields? Stablecoin yields refer to returns generated by holding certain stablecoins, typically through mechanisms like staking, lending, or other interest-generating activities within decentralized finance platforms. Q4: How might this legislation affect cryptocurrency markets? Continued regulatory uncertainty could reduce institutional participation, increase market volatility, and potentially drive innovation to more favorable jurisdictions if comprehensive legislation fails to pass. Q5: What happens if the White House withdraws support? Without White House support, the legislation faces significant obstacles in Congress, potentially delaying comprehensive cryptocurrency regulation for years and extending the current period of regulatory uncertainty. This post White House Crypto Bill Support Hangs in Balance as Coinbase Dispute Escalates Dramatically first appeared on BitcoinWorld .

title: Powell breaks protocol as Trump pressure escalates
body: The Trump administration recently renewed its fight with the Federal Reserve with a criminal investigation against chairman Jerome Powell that has revived memories of the 1970s inflation era, when political pressure weakened central banks and prices ran out of control. The comparison many economists are making is not subtle.In 2019, Recep Tayyip Erdoğan, the president of Turkey, fired central bank governor Murat Çetinkaya after he refused to cut rates.The result was brutal.The lira collapsed and inflation surged. Even then, Erdoğan never claimed the banker was a criminal. In the United States, Jay Powell, the Fed chair, is now facing a federal investigation over a $2.5bn renovation of the Fed’s headquarters. Powell breaks protocol as Trump pressure escalates As Cryptopolitan reported , Powell had released a short video on the Fed’s website, saying the investigation was a pretext designed by Trump to force deep interest rate cuts. That public response broke decades of Fed tradition and what has been Powell’s own personal style. Larry Kudlow, who previously ran the National Economic Council, said Jeanine Pirro, the U.S. attorney in Washington, “may have pulled the trigger” on Powell “a little too fast.” Markets stayed calm. Stocks barely moved. Bond yields were steady. Investors are betting the Fed will resist pressure to cut rates to near zero. Still, economists called the moment alarming. Since World War II, the White House and the Fed have acted as anchors of global stability. Now they are openly clashing. Klaas Knot, former head of the Dutch central bank, said the U.S. once supported institutions needed for a market economy to work. “It was leading by example,” he said. “They have apparently chosen to set an entirely different example.” The timing matters. Trump is traveling to Davos to sell his economic agenda as the Supreme Court hears arguments in the case of Lisa Cook. She is a Fed governor he tried to fire over mortgage fraud claims. Lisa denies them and has not been charged. Political backlash complicates Trump plans for the Fed The conflict between Trump and Powell is long-running. After appointing Powell, the president turned on him following rate hikes. During his second term, attacks intensified. Trump called Powell a “stubborn mule” and a “numbskull.” He said he would “love to fire” him for refusing to cut rates to 1 per cent. The White House later focused on the Fed building project, now $700mn over budget, which sits at the center of the DOJ probe. Powell stayed silent for months, even when Trump attempted to remove Lisa Cook. That changed with the video. Capitol Hill reacted. Thom Tillis of North Carolina backed Powell. Lisa Murkowski and John Kennedy followed. On Wall Street, Jamie Dimon joined Christine Lagarde in calling for central bank independence. Glenn Hubbard, former chair of George W Bush’s economic council, said Powell handled the video well. “He clarified what had happened,” Hubbard said. “He didn’t editorialise.” Hubbard also signed a letter condemning the probe, alongside every living former Fed chair. Inside the administration, cracks appeared. Scott Bessent, the Treasury secretary, publicly backed a review of the Fed but privately urged Trump not to pursue the investigation. Treasury officials later said there was “zero daylight” between Bessent and the president. Hubbard called the episode an “own goal of epic proportions.” The probe has made it harder for Trump to reshape the Fed. Powell’s chair term ends in four months, but he can stay on the board until January 2028. Allies say Powell is now reconsidering whether to step down. His exit would allow Trump to appoint another ally. Senate approval is another obstacle. Tillis has threatened to block any nominee until the probe is dropped. If that drags on, Powell could remain chair. The controversy has also hurt Kevin Hassett, a close Trump ally. Hassett backed the probe early, then said, “I expect that there’s nothing to see here.” Later, Trump hinted he might keep Hassett in his current role. Other names are floating. Kevin Warsh, Chris Waller, and Rick Rieder have stayed silent. Stephen Miran, already approved by the Senate, joined the Fed board last year. James Egelhof of BNP Paribas said the Fed would stick to its policy framework. Still, some funds are hedging. Pimco, which manages $2.2tn, is reducing exposure to the dollar. Paul Diggle warned of creeping politicisation. Adam Posen said governments are planning paths “not dependent on the US.” Even if the DOJ case fails, economists warn the damage may linger. Lael Brainard said officials may hesitate to speak freely. “Everybody is nervous,” she said, “that they too could be the subject of a criminal investigation.” Get seen where it counts. title: The Death of the Altseason: Why the 2025 Cycle Never Happened
body: In 2025, bitcoin reached historic highs but the expected “altseason” never materialized. Analysts point to institutional ETF inflows, diluted capital from thousands of new token launches, and investor preference for utility-driven projects as reasons for the collapse. Wintermute’s review shows altcoin rallies shrank to ~20 days versus 45–60 in prior years. A Paradigm Shift in

title: Jim Cramer said chip stocks are rising because companies lack the equipment needed to expand production
body: Jim Cramer says chip stocks are going up because companies can’t build new chips fast enough. Not because they don’t want to. They literally don’t have the tools. “We don’t have enough equipment to expand production of these chips, and we can’t put it together fast enough,” Jim said on his CNBC segment Friday night. Micron’s stock jumped 7.76% on Friday. Not a small move. The company makes memory and storage tech, especially for artificial intelligence. Its CEO, Sanjay Mehrotra, told Jim there’s no sign of things slowing down. “AI driven-demand is accelerating. It is real. It is here, and we need more and more memory to address that demand,” Sanjay said. They just started building a 600,000-square-foot site in upstate New York. It’s part of their plan to spend $200 billion on new chip production in the U.S. Micron, Seagate and others can’t keep up with AI orders That massive site? It’s not saving anything tomorrow. It’s years away. And Jim pointed that out. The only reason this kind of construction is even happening is because of the CHIPS Act. That law gives U.S. chipmakers government support to build locally. But laws don’t pour concrete. It’ll take time. That means the shortage isn’t getting fixed right away. And as long as demand stays hot, Jim says prices will just keep rising. Besides Micron, Jim called out other chip stocks that are already up big. Western Digital, Seagate, Sandisk are all benefiting from this crunch. He also said the shortage didn’t show up out of nowhere. Last year, everyone thought there were too many chips. Now? Total reversal. Jim said only one company saw this coming: Nvidia. “Only Nvidia really saw it coming,” Jim said . “They teamed up with the best of the best, Taiwan Semiconductor, to make all the high-end chips that are needed. There’s no bottleneck there. There’s no shortage, at least not in comparison to memory.” Markets stay up as global chaos is mostly ignored Even with everything going on around the world, stocks are still going up. The S&P 500 is higher. So is the Dow Jones, with a 3% gain this year. The Nasdaq is up 1.2%. Nobody’s pulling out of the market, even with Trump talking about military action or Greenland. Anthony Esposito, who runs AscalonVI Capital, told CNBC that markets haven’t cared about geopolitical risk for a while now. “Israel bombs Iran — the S&P 500 was down 1% overnight and closed down just 50bps. U.S. bombs Iran — almost no reaction,” he said. Venezuela and Greenland, he added, could even help U.S. markets because of energy, rare-earths and infrastructure. Europe’s Stoxx 600 is up almost 4%, even while everyone’s guessing what Trump might try with Greenland. Over in Asia, the MSCI AC Asia Pacific Index just hit a new high after jumping more than 5% this year. Japan’s Nikkei 225 and South Korea’s Kospi both hit records too. One last thing. The U.S. Supreme Court is expected to rule soon on Trump’s tariffs. It hasn’t happened yet. But investors don’t seem to be waiting. They’ve already adjusted to whatever changes came out of the White House in 2025. The smartest crypto minds already read our newsletter. Want in? Join them .

title: Ethereum ETF Momentum: Spot Funds Secure Fifth Day of Inflows as Investor Confidence Builds
body: BitcoinWorld Ethereum ETF Momentum: Spot Funds Secure Fifth Day of Inflows as Investor Confidence Builds In a significant display of sustained investor interest, U.S. spot Ethereum exchange-traded funds (ETFs) recorded a net inflow of $4.7 million on January 16, 2025, marking the fifth consecutive day of positive capital movement. This consistent pattern, derived from data provided by the analytics firm Farside Investors, signals a potential stabilization phase for these novel financial instruments following their highly anticipated launch. The data reveals a compelling divergence beneath the headline figure, however, with BlackRock’s iShares Ethereum Trust (ETHA) attracting $14.9 million while the Grayscale Ethereum Trust (ETHE) experienced an outflow of $10.2 million. Analyzing the Ethereum ETF Inflow Streak The five-day inflow streak for U.S. spot Ethereum ETFs represents a notable milestone in the short history of these products. Analysts often scrutinize consecutive flow data to gauge underlying market sentiment and product differentiation. This period of consistent net inflows suggests a growing, albeit measured, comfort level among institutional and retail investors with gaining direct exposure to Ethereum’s native asset, Ether (ETH), through a regulated, exchange-traded structure. The structure of these ETFs is crucial; they hold the actual cryptocurrency, unlike futures-based products, which track derivative contracts. Market observers point to several contextual factors that may be contributing to this trend. Firstly, the broader cryptocurrency market has shown signs of consolidation after a period of volatility, potentially encouraging entry at perceived stable levels. Secondly, increasing discussion around Ethereum’s ongoing technological upgrades, particularly its full transition to a proof-of-stake consensus mechanism, may be renewing long-term investor interest. Finally, the sheer novelty of the product category means early adoption curves are still being established, making multi-day trends particularly informative. The Divergence Between Major Fund Providers A deeper analysis of the January 16 data uncovers a significant narrative of competition and investor preference. The performance split between the two largest funds by asset base is stark. BlackRock’s ETHA, managed by the world’s largest asset manager, posted a robust single-day inflow of $14.9 million. Conversely, Grayscale’s ETHE, which converted from a long-standing closed-end trust into an ETF, saw $10.2 million leave the fund. This divergence can be attributed to several key factors familiar to ETF analysts: Fee Structures: Management fees are a primary driver of ETF flows. BlackRock’s ETHA launched with a highly competitive fee, while Grayscale’s ETHE, carrying over from its trust structure, initially had a significantly higher fee. Although Grayscale has since reduced its fee, the initial disparity created a powerful first impression. Brand and Distribution Power: BlackRock’s iShares platform boasts unparalleled distribution networks among financial advisors and institutional platforms, facilitating easier access for a vast swath of investors. Tracking Efficiency and Liquidity: Newer funds like ETHA were built from the ground up as ETFs, potentially offering tighter tracking to the net asset value (NAV) and efficient creation/redemption processes. Converted funds can sometimes face initial technical arbitrage. The table below summarizes the key contrasts between the two funds based on available public data: Fund (Ticker) Provider Jan 16 Flow Primary Consideration iShares Ethereum Trust (ETHA) BlackRock +$14.9M Inflow Competitive fee, strong distribution Grayscale Ethereum Trust (ETHE) Grayscale -$10.2M Outflow Legacy fee history, conversion from trust Expert Perspective on Flow Dynamics Financial analysts specializing in fund flows emphasize that this pattern is not uncommon in nascent ETF markets. “The early days of a new ETF category are always a battleground for assets,” notes a veteran ETF strategist whose commentary is frequently cited in financial media. “Investors are rationally moving toward the combination of lowest cost and strongest brand credibility. The consistent net inflow for the category is the more telling macro story—it shows the product concept itself is gaining traction, even as assets shuffle between providers.” This expert view underscores that while individual fund competition is fierce, the aggregate positive flow is a stronger indicator of the Ethereum ETF market’s health. Furthermore, data from Farside Investors provides an evidence-based foundation for this analysis. The firm’s independent tracking of daily fund flows is a widely referenced source within the investment community, adding a layer of verifiable authority to the reported figures. The five-day streak provides a small but meaningful dataset that begins to move beyond launch-day anomalies and toward revealing sustained investor behavior. Broader Implications for Cryptocurrency Markets The steady inflows into spot Ethereum ETFs carry implications beyond the funds themselves. Firstly, they represent a continuous, incremental source of buying pressure on the underlying Ether asset. Each dollar flowing into ETFs like ETHA requires the fund’s authorized participants to purchase an equivalent amount of Ether to back the new shares, creating a direct link between traditional finance capital and the crypto market. Secondly, this activity validates the regulatory pathway established by the U.S. Securities and Exchange Commission (SEC) in approving these products. The approval process was lengthy and scrutinized, making their subsequent market performance a point of interest for policymakers and future applicants, such as those proposing funds for other digital assets. The demonstrated investor demand supports the argument for a regulated access point to crypto assets. Finally, the flow data contributes to the maturation narrative of the cryptocurrency ecosystem. The ability to track daily inflows and outflows with the same tools used for traditional equity or bond ETFs normalizes Ethereum as an asset class for a broader audience. It shifts the discussion partially away from pure price speculation and toward metrics like product adoption, fee competition, and market structure. Conclusion The fifth consecutive day of net inflows for U.S. spot Ethereum ETFs, culminating in a $4.7 million addition on January 16, 2025, underscores a building, if cautious, wave of investor adoption. While the headline Ethereum ETF flow number is positive, the internal dynamics reveal a competitive landscape where low fees and powerful distribution, exemplified by BlackRock’s ETHA, are winning significant assets. In contrast, Grayscale’s ETHE continues to navigate its transition from a legacy product. This ongoing streak provides critical, early-stage evidence of demand for regulated crypto exposure. As the market for these innovative funds evolves, sustained flow data will remain a key barometer for measuring their integration into the mainstream financial portfolio. FAQs Q1: What does a ‘net inflow’ mean for an Ethereum ETF? A1: A net inflow occurs when the total amount of new money invested into an ETF over a period exceeds the amount withdrawn. For a spot Ethereum ETF, this typically means the fund’s manager must buy more of the underlying Ether to create new shares, directly increasing demand for the cryptocurrency. Q2: Why is there a difference between BlackRock’s ETHA and Grayscale’s ETHE flows? A2: The difference is primarily driven by factors like the fund’s expense ratio (fee), brand recognition, distribution network, and structural history. BlackRock’s ETHA launched with a very competitive fee and the power of the iShares platform, while Grayscale’s ETHE converted from a higher-fee closed-end fund, leading some investors to reallocate. Q3: How does Farside Investors track this data? A3: Farside Investors aggregates daily flow data from publicly available sources and fund issuers. They calculate net flows by estimating the creation and redemption activity of ETF shares, a standard methodology in the traditional ETF industry now applied to crypto ETFs. Q4: Do inflows into the ETF guarantee the price of Ethereum will rise? A4: No, while inflows create direct buying pressure for Ether, the price is influenced by a vast array of other factors including broader market sentiment, macroeconomic conditions, technological developments on the Ethereum network, and trading activity on global crypto exchanges. Q5: What is the significance of a ‘five-day streak’ of inflows? A5: In the context of a new financial product, a multi-day trend helps distinguish sustained interest from one-day volatility or launch hype. It suggests a pattern of accumulating interest rather than a fleeting reaction, providing a more reliable signal of early product-market fit. This post Ethereum ETF Momentum: Spot Funds Secure Fifth Day of Inflows as Investor Confidence Builds first appeared on BitcoinWorld .

title: Bitcoin Spot ETFs Face Stunning $394.7M Net Outflow, Halting Four-Day Inflow Streak
body: BitcoinWorld Bitcoin Spot ETFs Face Stunning $394.7M Net Outflow, Halting Four-Day Inflow Streak On January 16, 2025, the nascent U.S. Bitcoin spot ETF market experienced a significant shift, recording a collective net outflow of $394.7 million. This pivotal movement, reported by Farside Investors, decisively ended a four-day period of consecutive net inflows, prompting immediate analysis from market observers. The data provides a granular look at investor behavior across the major funds, revealing divergent strategies in a dynamic regulatory landscape. Breaking Down the Bitcoin ETF Outflow Data Farside Investors’ detailed flow data for January 16 presents a clear picture of the day’s activity. The figures highlight a notable divergence among the leading fund providers. While BlackRock’s iShares Bitcoin Trust (IBIT) managed to attract a modest $15.1 million in new capital, several other major funds saw substantial redemptions. Consequently, the aggregate effect tipped the scales toward a net negative flow for the entire product category. The specific outflows were led by Fidelity’s Wise Origin Bitcoin Fund (FBTC), which recorded a $205.2 million withdrawal. Similarly, Bitwise Bitcoin ETF (BITB) and the ARK 21Shares Bitcoin ETF (ARKB) posted outflows of $90.4 million and $69.4 million, respectively. Interestingly, Grayscale Bitcoin Trust (GBTC), which had previously dominated outflow figures since its conversion to an ETF, reported a comparatively lower $44.8 million outflow on this day. This shift in distribution suggests a potential rotation or a broadening of the factors influencing investor decisions. Contextualizing the Shift in ETF Flows To understand the importance of this single day’s data, one must consider the broader timeline. The U.S. Securities and Exchange Commission approved the first batch of spot Bitcoin ETFs on January 10, 2024. The initial launch period saw massive inflows as institutional and retail investors gained a regulated, accessible pathway to Bitcoin exposure. The four-day inflow streak immediately preceding January 16 had buoyed market sentiment, suggesting sustained demand. However, ETF flows are inherently volatile and respond to multiple macroeconomic and crypto-specific signals. Potential catalysts for the January 16 outflow include routine portfolio rebalancing by large institutions, profit-taking after a short-term price rally, or reactions to broader financial market conditions, such as movements in treasury yields or equity indices. Analysts consistently note that daily flow data represents a snapshot, not a long-term trend. Therefore, interpreting a single day’s movement requires caution and context. Expert Perspective on Market Mechanics Market structure experts often explain that ETF creation and redemption activity involves Authorized Participants (APs). These large financial institutions create new ETF shares by depositing the underlying asset—in this case, Bitcoin—with the fund issuer. Conversely, they redeem shares by returning them to the issuer in exchange for the underlying Bitcoin. The net flow figure represents the balance between these two processes across all funds. A net outflow indicates that share redemptions exceeded creations, leading to a reduction in the total Bitcoin held collectively by these ETFs, all else being equal. This mechanism directly links to on-chain Bitcoin movement. When an AP redeems shares, the trust must send Bitcoin to the AP, which may then sell it on the open market. This potential selling pressure is a key metric watched by traders. Data from blockchain analytics firms can often corroborate ETF flow data by tracking transfers from known custodian wallets, adding a layer of verifiable evidence to the reported figures. Comparative Analysis of Fund Performance A closer examination of the individual fund flows reveals strategic narratives. BlackRock’s IBIT maintaining a positive inflow, even if small, underscores its position as a market leader with strong brand recognition among traditional investors. Meanwhile, the significant outflow from Fidelity’s FBTC, a similarly trusted name, may point to specific client actions rather than a broad loss of confidence. The changing pattern for Grayscale’s GBTC is particularly noteworthy. In the weeks following its conversion from a closed-end fund, GBTC experienced billions in outflows, primarily attributed to investors exiting at a lower fee structure after being locked in at a premium or discount. The relatively smaller $44.8 million outflow on January 16 could signal that this major wave of exits is subsiding, allowing other funds’ flows to have a more pronounced impact on the daily net figure. The following table summarizes the key flow data for clarity: ETF Provider (Ticker) Net Flow for Jan. 16, 2025 Notable Context BlackRock (IBIT) +$15.1 Million Consistent inflow leader since launch. Fidelity (FBTC) -$205.2 Million Largest single-fund outflow of the day. Bitwise (BITB) -$90.4 Million Notable shift from prior inflow trends. ARK Invest (ARKB) -$69.4 Million Reflects volatility in growth-focused strategies. Grayscale (GBTC) -$44.8 Million Outflow magnitude has decreased significantly from initial post-conversion waves. Total Net Flow -$394.7 Million Ends a four-day net inflow streak. Potential Impacts and Forward Outlook The immediate impact of such an outflow often manifests in market sentiment and short-term price action. Traders monitor this data closely as an indicator of institutional demand. A single day of outflows, however, does not invalidate the structural success of the Bitcoin ETF product class. Since their launch, these funds have collectively gathered tens of billions in assets under management, representing a monumental shift in Bitcoin’s integration with traditional finance. Looking ahead, analysts will watch for whether January 16 marks an isolated event or the beginning of a new pattern. Key factors to monitor include: Fee Structures: Competitive fee wars among providers influence long-term asset gathering. Macro Environment: Interest rate expectations and inflation data affect all risk assets. Bitcoin Halving Cycle: The next Bitcoin block reward halving, anticipated in 2024, historically influences long-term market cycles. Regulatory Developments: Clarity from U.S. regulators on digital asset frameworks can boost or hinder confidence. Ultimately, the true test for Bitcoin spot ETFs will be their performance over quarterly and annual horizons, not daily fluctuations. Their ability to provide transparent, secure, and liquid exposure to Bitcoin for a vast investor base remains their core value proposition. Conclusion The $394.7 million net outflow from U.S. Bitcoin spot ETFs on January 16, 2025, serves as a stark reminder of the market’s inherent volatility and the complex factors driving institutional capital movements. While the day ended a positive four-day inflow streak, the data offers nuanced insights into shifting dynamics among the major funds. The event underscores the importance of analyzing ETF flows within a broader context of market structure, investor behavior, and macroeconomic trends. As the Bitcoin ETF ecosystem matures, such data points will continue to provide critical, real-time indicators of sentiment in the evolving intersection of cryptocurrency and traditional finance. FAQs Q1: What does a “net outflow” mean for a Bitcoin ETF? A net outflow occurs when the dollar value of shares redeemed from an ETF exceeds the value of shares created. For a spot Bitcoin ETF, this typically means the fund’s managers must sell some of the Bitcoin held in custody to return assets to investors redeeming their shares. Q2: Why did Grayscale’s GBTC have a smaller outflow compared to previous weeks? Many analysts believe the initial, massive wave of outflows from GBTC was driven by investors who were previously trapped in the closed-end fund structure, often selling to realize losses for tax purposes or moving to lower-fee competitors. That initial pressure may be easing. Q3: Can a single day of ETF outflows impact the Bitcoin price? Yes, it can contribute to short-term selling pressure. If the Bitcoin supporting the redeemed shares is sold on the open market by the Authorized Participants, it increases the available supply for sale, which can push the price down, all else being equal. Q4: Is Farside Investors the only source for this ETF flow data? No, while Farside is a widely cited and trusted source, other data firms like Bloomberg and ETF.com also track and publish this information. Analysts often cross-reference data for accuracy. Q5: How should long-term investors interpret daily ETF flow data? Long-term investors should view daily flows as noise within a larger trend. They are more indicative of short-term trader activity and institutional rebalancing than a fundamental shift in the asset’s long-term value proposition. Sustained multi-week or monthly trends hold more significance. This post Bitcoin Spot ETFs Face Stunning $394.7M Net Outflow, Halting Four-Day Inflow Streak first appeared on BitcoinWorld .

title: Bitcoin Cash Price Prediction 2026-2030: The Critical $1000 Milestone
body: BitcoinWorld Bitcoin Cash Price Prediction 2026-2030: The Critical $1000 Milestone As the cryptocurrency market evolves through 2025, investors globally are scrutinizing Bitcoin Cash’s potential trajectory toward the pivotal $1000 threshold between 2026 and 2030. This analysis examines the fundamental and technical factors that could determine BCH’s market performance, drawing from historical data, current adoption metrics, and verifiable blockchain developments. Market analysts particularly focus on Bitcoin Cash’s unique value proposition as a peer-to-peer electronic cash system, especially as global payment networks undergo significant transformation. Bitcoin Cash Price Prediction: Analyzing the 2026 Landscape Bitcoin Cash enters 2026 with several established advantages in the cryptocurrency ecosystem. The network consistently processes transactions with lower fees than its Bitcoin counterpart, according to blockchain data from 2024. Furthermore, merchant adoption continues expanding across multiple continents, particularly in regions seeking affordable digital payment solutions. Technical analysis of BCH’s price history reveals established support levels that provide crucial context for future projections. Market sentiment toward Bitcoin Cash often correlates with broader cryptocurrency cycles, yet the asset demonstrates distinct characteristics during market fluctuations. Several measurable factors will influence Bitcoin Cash’s price trajectory in 2026. Network upgrade implementations, including potential smart contract enhancements, could significantly impact developer activity. Additionally, regulatory developments in major economies will affect institutional adoption rates. Historical volatility patterns suggest that Bitcoin Cash typically experiences heightened price movements during quarterly contract expirations on major exchanges. The relationship between Bitcoin’s dominance index and alternative cryptocurrency performance remains a critical analytical framework for predicting BCH behavior. Expert Perspectives on 2026 Price Ranges Financial institutions and blockchain analysts present varied but evidence-based projections for Bitcoin Cash in 2026. For instance, recent technical analysis reports reference Fibonacci retracement levels from previous market cycles. Meanwhile, fundamental analysts emphasize on-chain metrics like active address growth and transaction volume trends. The consensus among technical analysts suggests that Bitcoin Cash must maintain specific support zones to sustain bullish momentum. Conversely, breaking below established technical levels could trigger different market scenarios that analysts continuously monitor. Bitcoin Cash 2027 Forecast: Adoption Versus Competition The 2027 outlook for Bitcoin Cash involves complex interactions between technological development and market competition. Payment processor integrations announced throughout 2025 will reach full implementation, potentially increasing real-world utility. However, competing payment-focused cryptocurrencies continue evolving with their own technological improvements. Network effect becomes increasingly crucial as cryptocurrency payment adoption reaches potential inflection points. Bitcoin Cash’s development roadmap includes scalability enhancements that could differentiate its value proposition from both traditional payment systems and newer blockchain projects. Market analysts particularly watch Bitcoin Cash’s performance relative to other major payment cryptocurrencies. Comparative transaction speed and cost data from 2024-2025 provides benchmarks for evaluating competitive advantages. Furthermore, cross-border remittance partnerships established in developing economies could drive substantial volume increases. The technological architecture of Bitcoin Cash, with its emphasis on larger block sizes, faces ongoing tests as transaction volumes potentially approach new thresholds. These technical limits will influence both network reliability and investor confidence throughout the forecast period. Institutional Factors Influencing 2027 Valuation Institutional cryptocurrency adoption trends significantly impact Bitcoin Cash’s potential 2027 valuation. Investment vehicles like exchange-traded funds (ETFs) and regulated custody solutions create new access points for traditional investors. Regulatory clarity emerging from legislative processes in multiple jurisdictions reduces uncertainty for institutional participants. Additionally, corporate treasury adoption of cryptocurrencies for payment systems and balance sheet diversification introduces new demand dynamics. These institutional factors interact with retail market sentiment to create complex price discovery mechanisms that analysts must carefully evaluate. The 2028-2030 Horizon: Long-Term Technical and Fundamental Drivers Projecting Bitcoin Cash prices toward 2030 requires analyzing both cyclical patterns and structural market evolution. Historical cryptocurrency market cycles suggest potential periodicity in price peaks and troughs, though each cycle demonstrates unique characteristics. The Bitcoin halving event scheduled for 2028 will likely influence the entire cryptocurrency market, including Bitcoin Cash’s valuation. Long-term adoption curves for digital payment systems provide contextual frameworks for estimating Bitcoin Cash’s market penetration potential. Technological innovations in layer-two solutions and interoperability protocols could further enhance Bitcoin Cash’s utility beyond its current capabilities. Demographic shifts in cryptocurrency adoption present another crucial consideration for long-term projections. Younger generations increasingly familiar with digital assets may drive different usage patterns than early adopters. Environmental, social, and governance (ESG) considerations continue influencing institutional investment decisions toward cryptocurrencies with specific technical characteristics. Bitcoin Cash’s energy consumption profile relative to proof-of-work alternatives remains a subject of ongoing analysis and technological development. These multifaceted factors collectively shape the probability distribution of potential price outcomes through the decade’s end. Quantitative Models and Scenario Analysis Financial analysts employ various quantitative models to project Bitcoin Cash prices through 2030. Time-series analysis incorporating volatility clustering and mean reversion characteristics provides statistical frameworks for price forecasting. Monte Carlo simulations generate probability distributions for potential price outcomes based on historical volatility and correlation data. Furthermore, network value models relating price to measurable adoption metrics like transaction count and active addresses offer fundamentally-grounded valuation approaches. These analytical methods consistently emphasize the inherent uncertainty in long-term cryptocurrency price predictions while identifying key variables that drive potential outcomes. Bitcoin Cash Price Prediction Summary 2026-2030 Year Key Drivers Potential Scenarios 2026 Regulatory developments, network upgrades, Bitcoin market correlation Consolidation within established ranges or breakout based on adoption metrics 2027 Payment integration expansion, competitive landscape evolution Significant movement based on real-world utility milestones 2028-2030 Halving event impacts, generational adoption shifts, technological innovation Potential for exponential growth or stabilization based on market maturity The $1000 Question: Analyzing Probability Factors The possibility of Bitcoin Cash reaching $1000 involves specific technical and fundamental prerequisites. Market capitalization calculations indicate the required valuation increase relative to current levels and circulating supply. Historical resistance levels and psychological price barriers create technical hurdles that Bitcoin Cash must overcome. Furthermore, the broader cryptocurrency market capitalization would need to expand significantly to support such valuations across multiple assets. The $1000 price point represents not just a numerical threshold but a symbolic milestone that could influence market psychology and media coverage. Several measurable conditions could increase the probability of Bitcoin Cash achieving $1000 valuation. Sustained increases in daily transaction volume would demonstrate growing utility beyond speculative trading. Major payment processor integrations reaching critical mass could drive consistent demand unrelated to market sentiment. Technological innovations successfully addressing scalability while maintaining security would strengthen the fundamental investment thesis. Additionally, regulatory frameworks that legitimize cryptocurrency payments without stifling innovation could accelerate adoption curves. These factors interact in complex ways that defy simple linear projection but establish boundary conditions for potential outcomes. Risk Factors and Alternative Scenarios Realistic Bitcoin Cash price prediction must acknowledge significant risk factors and alternative scenarios. Technological vulnerabilities or successful attacks on the network could undermine confidence and valuation. Regulatory crackdowns in major markets could restrict access and utility, depressing prices. Furthermore, superior competing technologies could capture market share in the payment cryptocurrency segment. Macroeconomic conditions including interest rate environments and traditional market performance influence cryptocurrency valuations through risk appetite channels. These risk factors necessitate probabilistic thinking rather than deterministic prediction when considering long-term price targets like $1000. Conclusion Bitcoin Cash price prediction for 2026 through 2030 involves analyzing interconnected technological, regulatory, and market dynamics. The potential for BCH to reach $1000 depends on multiple factors aligning favorably, including adoption acceleration, technological robustness, and supportive market conditions. Investors should consider Bitcoin Cash’s unique value proposition as electronic cash alongside rigorous risk assessment when evaluating long-term price projections. The evolving cryptocurrency landscape will undoubtedly present both opportunities and challenges as Bitcoin Cash approaches these forecast horizons. FAQs Q1: What are the main factors driving Bitcoin Cash price predictions? The primary factors include adoption metrics, technological developments, regulatory changes, market sentiment, and broader cryptocurrency trends. Analysts particularly monitor transaction volume growth, network upgrades, and institutional integration. Q2: How does Bitcoin Cash differ from Bitcoin in price prediction models? They represent probabilistic scenarios based on current information rather than guaranteed outcomes. Q5: What would need to happen for Bitcoin Cash to reach $1000? No single factor guarantees this price level. This post Bitcoin Cash Price Prediction 2026-2030: The Critical $1000 Milestone first appeared on BitcoinWorld .

title: White House is angry over Coinbase’s surprise withdrawal
body: The White House is threatening to withdraw its backing for the Senate Committee’s crypto market structure bill, meant to go on vote last Thursday. Now, they are advocating for Coinbase to get back on board with lawmakers after the exchange’s CEO said it “can’t support the way the law is written.” According to a source close to the administration, the White House is prepared to walk away from the legislation if Coinbase does not return to negotiations and agree to a yield framework that satisfies banking interests and brings all parties back to consensus. On Wednesday through Thursday, senior administration officials, lawmakers, and industry figures were prepared to vote on the nearly 300-page Clarity Act. Coinbase’s word that it would not be part of its supporters forced the committee to postpone the vote and hold more discussions, much to the disappointment of the Oval Office. White House is angry over Coinbase’s surprise withdrawal Speaking to Crypto In America journalist Eleanor Terrett, the source said Coinbase made a “unilateral” move that blindsided the White House and other stakeholders. The White House has privately called Coinbase’s action a “rug pull” against the administration and the crypto industry, according to the source. Washington has blasted the crypto exchange for trying to “dictate the fate of industry-wide legislation,” reiterating that the bill was negotiated by a coalition of lawmakers, regulators, and market participants. “This is President Trump’s bill at the end of the day, not Brian Armstrong’s,” the source said. President Trump has been very supportive of digital asset innovation since his return to the US top seat, and his administration backed the House version of the Clarity Act earlier this year. But the POTUS’s camp is now willing to let the bill fail rather than accept “pressure from a single company.” Coinbase chief executive Brian Armstrong defended his company’s decision in a CNBC interview on Thursday, saying the firm had identified provisions that would harm consumers. “The high-level principle is that you can’t really have banks come in and try to kill their competition at the expense of the American consumer,” he told the news outlet. Armstrong had first publicized Coinbase’s opposition in a post on X late Wednesday, writing: “Coinbase unfortunately can’t support the bill as written. This version would be materially worse than the current status quo. We’d rather have no bill than a bad bill.” As Cryptopolitan reported on Friday, he explained that traditional savings accounts pay about 14 basis points on average, and stablecoin rewards that can reach 3.8%, which is an opportunity for banks to innovate with no risks to their business models. Months of discussions halted by one company Congressional staff had reportedly worked with industry representatives for months to craft the Clarity Act, meant to define regulatory boundaries for trading, custody, issuance, and decentralized finance. Coinbase, now publicly traded on Nasdaq with a market value near $70 billion, helped finance a network of political action committees that spent more than $130 million during the 2024 election cycle to back crypto-friendly candidates. Some netizens think the support may have gotten the company its loud influence on crypto-related bills. “Coinbase alone does not speak for the crypto industry and should not have a stranglehold on legislation. I also do not believe that the yield on stablecoins should be the deciding factor. This bill, at its core, has nothing to do with yield on stablecoins,” said one proponent of the market structure bill on X. When asked whether talks had resumed after the surprise withdrawal, Kara Calvert, Coinbase’s head of US policy, said the pause was a “shock to the system.” “We want to be respectful of the fact that blood, sweat, and tears have gone into this bill. I can’t stress enough how impressive it has been for the Senate staff and the Senators themselves who met for hundreds of hours at the member level to discuss these details…We want to make sure we are at the table working through this details, that we are going to get this done, and I don’t think anyone is walking away, Democrat, Republican, and I think even the industry is still absolutely united,” she said in an interview with Crypto In America. Want your project in front of crypto’s top minds? Feature it in our next industry report, where data meets impact.

title: Steak ‘n Shake Doubles Down: Strategic $10M Bitcoin Purchase Signals Bold Treasury Shift
body: BitcoinWorld Steak ‘n Shake Doubles Down: Strategic $10M Bitcoin Purchase Signals Bold Treasury Shift In a decisive move that underscores growing institutional confidence, the iconic U.S. fast-food chain Steak ‘n Shake has allocated an additional $10 million to purchase Bitcoin (BTC). This strategic acquisition, confirmed by corporate filings in Indianapolis, Indiana, on April 2, 2025, follows the company’s earlier pledge to accept BTC payments and hold all received cryptocurrency. Consequently, this action transforms the restaurant operator into a notable participant in the corporate digital asset treasury landscape. Steak ‘n Shake Bitcoin Strategy: From Payments to Treasury Reserve The recent $10 million Bitcoin purchase represents a significant escalation of Steak ‘n Shake’s public cryptocurrency strategy. Initially, the company announced it would begin accepting Bitcoin for customer payments. Importantly, the firm stated it would not immediately convert these crypto payments to fiat currency. Instead, management planned to hold them as a long-term strategic reserve on its balance sheet. Therefore, this latest direct market purchase of $10 million in BTC demonstrates a committed, multi-pronged approach to Bitcoin accumulation. Corporate treasury adoption of Bitcoin has evolved through distinct phases. First, pioneering companies like MicroStrategy and Tesla made headline-grabbing allocations. Subsequently, a second wave focused on payment integration and balance sheet hedging emerged. Steak ‘n Shake’s strategy uniquely combines both approaches. The company now sources Bitcoin directly from operational revenue and through deliberate treasury allocation. This dual-path method potentially mitigates price volatility risks associated with a single acquisition method. Analyzing the Corporate Bitcoin Adoption Timeline The journey of Bitcoin into corporate treasuries provides essential context for Steak ‘n Shake’s decision. Notably, MicroStrategy began its aggressive accumulation strategy in August 2020. Since then, dozens of publicly traded companies have followed, albeit with varying levels of commitment. For a traditional consumer brand like Steak ‘n Shake, this move signals a maturation of the thesis beyond the technology sector. Several key factors typically drive these corporate decisions: Inflation Hedging: Companies seek assets uncorrelated to traditional monetary policy. Long-Term Store of Value: Bitcoin’s finite supply contrasts with expansive fiat currency systems. Strategic Differentiation: Adoption can attract new customer demographics and signal innovation. Operational Integration: Using Bitcoin for payments tests future financial infrastructure. Steak ‘n Shake’s announcement explicitly connects its payment system to its treasury strategy. This creates a closed-loop ecosystem where cryptocurrency circulates within the brand’s economic sphere. Furthermore, holding customer-paid Bitcoin aligns corporate and customer interests in the asset’s long-term performance. Financial Implications and Balance Sheet Considerations From an accounting perspective, Steak ‘n Shake’s Bitcoin holdings introduce specific considerations. Under current U.S. accounting standards, cryptocurrencies like Bitcoin are typically classified as indefinite-lived intangible assets. This classification requires impairment testing if the market price falls below the carrying value. However, upward revaluations are not recognized until the asset is sold. Therefore, the $10 million purchase will appear on the balance sheet at cost, subject to potential impairment charges. This accounting treatment creates a notable asymmetry. Significant price increases do not boost quarterly earnings, while declines can trigger impairment losses. Nevertheless, companies like MicroStrategy have maintained this approach, prioritizing long-term holding over short-term earnings impact. Steak ‘n Shake’s management appears to embrace a similar long-term horizon, viewing Bitcoin as a strategic reserve rather than a trading asset. The following table compares recent corporate Bitcoin purchases in the consumer sector: Company Sector Approximate BTC Purchase Announcement Date Stated Strategy Steak ‘n Shake Fast Food / Restaurants $10 Million April 2025 Treasury Reserve & Payment Acceptance A publicly traded gaming company (2024) Entertainment $25 Million Q3 2024 Inflation Hedge & Diversification A regional retail chain (2024) Consumer Retail $5 Million November 2024 Technology Investment & Brand Positioning Market Impact and Industry Reaction The announcement immediately generated discussion among financial analysts and industry observers. Many experts highlight the symbolic importance of a mainstream, legacy brand making such an allocation. While technology companies often lead innovation adoption, consumer-facing brands like Steak ‘n Shake operate closer to the everyday economy. Their embrace of Bitcoin potentially normalizes cryptocurrency for a broader audience. Market reaction also extends to Bitcoin’s perceived role as a corporate asset. Each public company addition to the Bitcoin treasury club adds validation to the underlying investment thesis. Moreover, it creates a growing cohort of businesses with aligned interests in the development of supportive regulation and infrastructure. This collective advocacy could influence future policy decisions regarding digital asset accounting, custody, and disclosure. However, critics consistently point to Bitcoin’s price volatility as a primary risk. Quarterly earnings could experience unnecessary volatility due to impairment charges. Additionally, regulatory uncertainty remains a concern for all corporations holding digital assets. Steak ‘n Shake’s management presumably conducted thorough risk assessment before proceeding. Their decision to proceed indicates a calculated acceptance of these risks in pursuit of potential long-term strategic benefits. The Practical Mechanics of Payment Integration Beyond the treasury purchase, the operational aspect of accepting Bitcoin payments presents its own challenges and opportunities. Steak ‘n Shake must implement a point-of-sale solution that can securely process Bitcoin transactions. This likely involves a partnership with a established cryptocurrency payment processor. These processors typically instantly convert the Bitcoin to fiat at the time of sale, shielding the merchant from price fluctuations during the transaction. Steak ‘n Shake’s model differs significantly. The company intends to retain the Bitcoin received. Therefore, it must manage private key security, a non-trivial operational responsibility. Best practices involve using qualified custodians or institutional-grade cold storage solutions. The company’s willingness to undertake this operational complexity underscores the strategic nature of its commitment. It is not merely a marketing gimmick but a foundational shift in how it views a portion of its assets. This approach could also influence customer behavior. Patrons who own Bitcoin might be incentivized to spend it at Steak ‘n Shake, knowing the company becomes a long-term holder alongside them. This creates a novel form of brand alignment and community. Furthermore, it introduces Bitcoin as a practical medium of exchange for a tangible good—a hamburger and milkshake—moving beyond abstract investment discussions. Conclusion Steak ‘n Shake’s $10 million Bitcoin purchase represents a consequential step in the institutional adoption of cryptocurrency. By combining direct treasury allocation with a customer payment integration strategy, the company has crafted a multifaceted approach to Bitcoin exposure. This move provides real-world evidence of Bitcoin’s evolving role from speculative asset to potential corporate reserve asset. While risks related to volatility and regulation persist, Steak ‘n Shake’s decision reflects a growing trend among diverse businesses to explore digital assets as a component of long-term financial strategy. The success of this Steak ‘n Shake Bitcoin initiative will undoubtedly influence other consumer brands considering similar pathways into the digital economy. FAQs Q1: How much Bitcoin did Steak ‘n Shake purchase? Steak ‘n Shake purchased an additional $10 million worth of Bitcoin (BTC). This follows its earlier strategy to hold all Bitcoin received from customer payments. Q2: Why would a fast-food company buy Bitcoin? Companies like Steak ‘n Shake may allocate to Bitcoin as a long-term strategic reserve, a potential hedge against inflation, and to integrate innovative payment technologies that align with future financial systems. Q3: Can I pay for my meal at Steak ‘n Shake with Bitcoin? According to the company’s announcements, Steak ‘n Shake plans to accept Bitcoin for payments. The specific rollout timeline and store locations for this feature should be confirmed directly with the company. Q4: How does this purchase affect Steak ‘n Shake’s financial statements? Under current accounting rules, the Bitcoin will be held as an intangible asset on the balance sheet at its purchase cost. The company may need to record impairment charges if Bitcoin’s market value falls below its carrying value, but increases in value are not recorded until sale. Q5: Is this a common practice for restaurants? While a growing number of companies across sectors hold Bitcoin, it remains relatively uncommon for major fast-food chains. Steak ‘n Shake’s move places it among the early adopters in the restaurant industry exploring corporate Bitcoin treasury strategy. This post Steak ‘n Shake Doubles Down: Strategic $10M Bitcoin Purchase Signals Bold Treasury Shift first appeared on BitcoinWorld .

title: Belarus Opens Door To Crypto Banks With New Presidential Decree
body: Belarus took a major step on January 16, 2026, when President Aleksandr Lukashenko signed Decree No. 19 to set rules for so-called “cryptobanks.” The move creates a clear legal spot for companies that want to mix token services with classic banking and payment work. Decree Defines Cryptobanks And Rules According to the decree, a cryptobank is a joint-stock company that may carry out token operations alongside banking, payment and other financial services. Reports have disclosed that these firms must be residents of the Belarus High-Tech Park (HTP) and will be listed in a special register kept by the National Bank. The new document ties cryptobank status to HTP residency, which aims to concentrate activity inside a known tech zone. That requirement also means the HTP’s rules will play a role in daily oversight. Requirements For Market Entry Based on reports from regulators, cryptobanks will face dual supervision: oversight from both the National Bank of the Republic of Belarus and the HTP’s governing bodies. This twin structure is meant to let token services grow while keeping closer control of financial risks. Officials say cryptobanks will follow many of the rules that apply to non-bank credit and financial organizations, including standards for capital, risk controls and anti-money-laundering checks. That suggests applicants will need to show robust compliance systems before being accepted into the register. Belarus: Short-Term Business Plans National Bank officials said that the decree could be followed by real market steps fast. Aliaksandr Yahorau, the First Deputy Chairman of the National Bank, said Belarus could see its first operating cryptobank within six months after laws and rules are aligned. He added that cryptobanks may be able to issue loans secured by cryptocurrency, provide payment cards linked to crypto accounts, and allow self-employed people to receive salaries in tokens. What Comes Next For Belarus The decree builds on earlier efforts to attract tech and crypto business to Belarus, and it clearly signals a state interest in bringing token activity under formal control. The next steps will include drafting implementing rules, creating the special registry at the National Bank, and deciding capital and licensing thresholds for applicants. Featured image from Unsplash, chart from TradingView

title: Render (RNDR) Price Prediction: A Definitive 2026-2030 Outlook Amidst Explosive GPU Demand
body: BitcoinWorld Render (RNDR) Price Prediction: A Definitive 2026-2030 Outlook Amidst Explosive GPU Demand As global demand for computational power surges into 2025, the Render Network (RNDR) stands at a critical juncture, positioning its native token for significant revaluation through 2030. This analysis provides a data-driven, long-term forecast for RNDR, examining the fundamental technological adoption, market dynamics, and macroeconomic factors that will shape its trajectory over the next six years. The decentralized GPU rendering marketplace has evolved from a niche solution to a vital infrastructure component for industries ranging from Hollywood visual effects to architectural visualization and artificial intelligence training. Render (RNDR) Price Prediction: Foundation and Market Context Launched by Jules Urbach’s OTOY in 2017, the Render Network fundamentally reimagines digital rendering. The platform connects users needing GPU power with providers who have idle capacity, creating a decentralized marketplace. Consequently, RNDR tokens facilitate all transactions on this peer-to-peer network. The network’s migration to the Solana blockchain in late 2023 marked a pivotal upgrade, drastically improving transaction speed and reducing costs. This technological shift provides essential infrastructure for scaling, a critical factor for any long-term RNDR price prediction. Market analysts from firms like Messari and CoinShares frequently highlight Render’s unique position at the intersection of blockchain and the high-growth digital creation economy. Current Adoption Metrics and Network Growth Render’s adoption provides concrete evidence of its utility. According to public network data, the platform has completed millions of rendering jobs for major studios and independent creators. Furthermore, partnerships with industry-standard software like OctaneRender create a powerful ecosystem lock-in. The network’s total value locked (TVL) and quarterly job volume serve as key performance indicators. These metrics, rather than pure speculation, form the basis for a rational RNDR price prediction. For instance, increased adoption by AI companies for model training could represent a new, massive addressable market beyond traditional media. Analyzing Key Drivers for RNDR’s 2026-2030 Trajectory Several interdependent factors will primarily determine the Render token’s price movement through the end of the decade. First, the exponential growth in demand for GPU compute, driven by AI, metaverse development, and high-fidelity rendering, creates a powerful tailwind. Second, the network’s ability to scale efficiently and maintain competitive pricing against centralized cloud providers like AWS and Google Cloud is crucial. Third, broader cryptocurrency market cycles and regulatory developments for utility tokens will inevitably influence investor sentiment. Finally, the execution of the Render Network’s roadmap, including proposed features like real-time streaming and dynamic NFTs, will impact its perceived future value. GPU Compute Demand: The global shortage of high-end GPUs and rising cloud costs benefit decentralized alternatives. Network Scalability: Solana’s infrastructure must support exponentially more transactions without congestion. Market Sentiment: RNDR remains correlated, though not perfectly, with major crypto assets like Bitcoin and Ethereum. Roadmap Execution: Timely delivery of promised technical upgrades builds trust and utility. Render RNDR Price Prediction: Year-by-Year Forecast Model (2026-2030) The following table presents a scenario-based forecast model. It synthesizes historical volatility, projected network usage growth, and analyst consensus from institutional reports. Importantly, these figures represent potential ranges based on current data and should not be considered financial advice. They assume continued technological execution and no catastrophic regulatory intervention in the decentralized compute sector. Year Conservative Scenario Base Case Scenario Bullish Scenario Primary Catalyst 2026 $12 – $18 $18 – $28 $28 – $40 Mainstream AI studio adoption 2027 $20 – $30 $30 – $45 $45 – $65 Integration with major 3D software suites 2028 $35 – $50 $50 – $75 $75 – $110 Network effects and significant market share capture 2029 $50 – $70 $70 – $100 $100 – $150 Ubiquity in real-time rendering for immersive media 2030 $65 – $90 $90 – $130 $130 – $200+ Establishment as core Web3 infrastructure Expert Insights and Comparative Analysis Industry experts emphasize the total addressable market (TAM) as a core valuation metric. “The cloud rendering market alone is projected to exceed $20 billion by 2030,” notes a senior analyst from a fintech research firm. “Render’s model captures value from this and adjacent AI training markets.” Comparatively, other decentralized compute projects like Akash Network (AKT) operate in a broader cloud marketplace, while Render’s specialized focus provides deeper vertical integration. This specialization could command a premium valuation multiple if execution succeeds. Technical analysts also monitor on-chain data, such as token holder concentration and exchange flow, to gauge long-term investor conviction versus short-term trading activity. Potential Risks and Challenges to the Forecast Any long-term RNDR price prediction must acknowledge substantial risks. Technological competition is fierce, with both traditional cloud giants and new blockchain projects vying for market share. Regulatory uncertainty surrounding the classification of utility tokens persists in major economies like the United States and the European Union. Additionally, the inherent volatility of the cryptocurrency asset class means macroeconomic events, such as interest rate shifts or geopolitical tensions, can cause severe price dislocations unrelated to Render’s fundamentals. Finally, execution risk remains; any failure to scale the network or a critical security vulnerability could severely impact trust and token value. Conclusion This Render (RNDR) price prediction for 2026 through 2030 outlines a growth trajectory fundamentally tied to the network’s real-world utility and adoption. The expansion of the digital creation economy, coupled with rising demand for efficient GPU compute, positions RNDR as a potentially critical infrastructure token. While price targets provide a framework, the ultimate valuation will depend on the Render Network’s execution against its roadmap, its competitive positioning, and the broader maturation of the cryptocurrency market. Investors and observers should prioritize monitoring network usage metrics, partnership announcements, and technological milestones over short-term price fluctuations to assess the long-term health of the project. FAQs Q1: What is the main utility of the RNDR token? The RNDR token is the exclusive medium of exchange on the Render Network. Clients use it to pay for GPU rendering jobs, and node operators earn it for providing their spare computational power. It functions as a utility token within this specific ecosystem. Q2: How does the migration to Solana affect the RNDR price prediction? The migration to Solana is generally viewed as a positive, long-term fundamental upgrade. It enables faster, cheaper transactions, which improves user experience and allows the network to scale to handle more jobs. This enhanced efficiency and scalability support higher network usage, a key driver for token demand in forecasts. Q3: What is the biggest competitor to the Render Network? Render faces competition on two fronts: from centralized cloud rendering services like AWS, Google Cloud, and Azure; and from other decentralized compute networks like Akash Network and Golem. Its competitive edge lies in its specialization for graphics rendering and deep integration with tools like OctaneRender. Q4: How does AI development impact RNDR’s future? AI development is a significant potential growth driver. Training complex AI models requires immense GPU power. Render’s decentralized network could offer a cost-effective alternative to centralized clouds for AI researchers and companies, potentially opening a vast new market beyond its core media and entertainment focus. Q5: Should RNDR price predictions be considered financial advice? No. All price predictions, including this RNDR forecast, are analytical models based on current data, trends, and assumptions. They are inherently speculative and should be used for informational and research purposes only. Always conduct your own due diligence and consult with a qualified financial advisor before making any investment decisions.
